name: Dan Aykroyd
bio: Original cast member (1975-1979). Known for his Blues Brothers character with John Belushi, the Coneheads, and impersonations of Richard Nixon and Jimmy Carter. Co-head writer and one of the show's foundational talents.

name: John Belushi
bio: Original cast member (1975-1979). Created iconic characters including the Samurai and one half of the Blues Brothers. Known for his wild, physical comedy style. Left to pursue film career. Died in 1982.

name: Chevy Chase
bio: Original cast member (1975-1976). First Weekend Update anchor and the show's first breakout star. Known for his trademark pratfalls and 'Live from New York' catchphrase. Left after one and a half seasons for a film career.

name: Jane Curtin
bio: Original cast member (1975-1980). Co-anchor of Weekend Update and part of the Coneheads. Known for her deadpan delivery and straight-woman roles. Left with the entire original cast in 1980.

name: Garrett Morris
bio: Original cast member (1975-1980). First African American cast member. Known for Chico Escuela character and musical performances. Left with the original cast in 1980.

name: Laraine Newman
bio: Original cast member (1975-1980). Founding member of The Groundlings. Known for character work and impressions. Left with the original cast in 1980 to pursue other projects.

name: Gilda Radner
bio: Original cast member (1975-1980). Created beloved characters including Roseanne Roseannadanna, Emily Litella, and Lisa Loopner. One of the show's most popular performers. Left in 1980. Died in 1989.

name: Bill Murray
bio: Cast member (1977-1980). Replaced Chevy Chase in Season 2. Known for Nick the Lounge Singer and Weekend Update appearances. Left to pursue film career and became a comedy icon.

name: Eddie Murphy
bio: Cast member (1980-1984). Credited with saving the show during its troubled early 1980s period. Created characters like Mr. Robinson, Gumby, and Buckwheat. Left for hugely successful film career.

name: Joe Piscopo
bio: Cast member (1980-1984). Starred alongside Eddie Murphy during the rebuilding years. Known for impressions of Frank Sinatra and sportscaster impersonations. Left after Murphy's departure.

name: Billy Crystal
bio: Cast member (1984-1985). Joined after hosting twice. Known for character Fernando ('You look mahvelous'). Left after one season to focus on film and standup career.

name: Martin Short
bio: Cast member (1984-1985). Known for characters Ed Grimley and Jackie Rogers Jr. Left after one season for film and television work. Later became a Five-Timers Club host.

name: Christopher Guest
bio: Cast member (1984-1985). Writer and performer known for his deadpan humor. Left after one season. Later found success as a mockumentary filmmaker.

name: Julia Louis-Dreyfus
bio: Cast member (1982-1985). Featured player who later became a major television star with Seinfeld and Veep. First former female cast member to host the show.

name: Dana Carvey
bio: Cast member (1986-1993). Created iconic characters including Church Lady, Garth Algar, and impressions of George H.W. Bush. One of the most successful cast members of the late 1980s-early 1990s.

name: Phil Hartman
bio: Cast member (1986-1994). Known as 'the Glue' for his versatility. Created Unfrozen Caveman Lawyer and impressions of Bill Clinton. Died in 1998 in a tragic murder-suicide.

name: Jan Hooks
bio: Cast member (1986-1991). Known for characters like Brenda the Waitress and impressions including Tammy Faye Bakker. Strong character actress during the late 1980s. Died in 2014.

name: Dennis Miller
bio: Cast member (1985-1991). Weekend Update anchor known for his intellectual, reference-heavy comedy style. Left to pursue talk show and commentary career.

name: Kevin Nealon
bio: Cast member (1986-1995). Weekend Update anchor (1991-1994) and known for Mr. Subliminal character. Long tenure spanning two eras of the show.

name: Jon Lovitz
bio: Cast member (1985-1990). Known for characters including Pathological Liar Tommy Flanagan and Master Thespian. Catchphrase: 'Yeah, that's the ticket!'

name: Mike Myers
bio: Cast member (1989-1995). Created Wayne Campbell (Wayne's World), Dieter, and Linda Richman. Left for film career after Wayne's World became a cultural phenomenon.

name: Chris Farley
bio: Cast member (1990-1995). Known for high-energy physical comedy. Created Matt Foley (motivational speaker) and Chippendales audition sketch. Left for film career. Died in 1997.

name: Adam Sandler
bio: Cast member (1990-1995). Known for Opera Man, Canteen Boy, and original songs. Left after being fired, then became one of Hollywood's biggest comedy stars.

name: Chris Rock
bio: Cast member (1990-1993). Known for his Weekend Update commentaries and strong standup-influenced style. Left for standup and film career.

name: David Spade
bio: Cast member (1990-1996). Known for 'Hollywood Minute' on Weekend Update and snarky receptionist character. Part of the 'Bad Boys' era of SNL.

name: Rob Schneider
bio: Cast member (1990-1994). Known for characters like Richmeister ('Making copies') and orgasm guy. Part of the early 1990s ensemble.

name: Norm Macdonald
bio: Cast member (1993-1998). Weekend Update anchor (1994-1997) known for his deadpan delivery and controversial takes. Left after being fired from Update.

name: Molly Shannon
bio: Cast member (1995-2001). Created beloved character Mary Katherine Gallagher ('Superstar!'). Known for energetic, physical comedy style spanning six seasons.

name: Will Ferrell
bio: Cast member (1995-2002). One of the most successful cast members ever. Created characters including More Cowbell's Gene Frenkle, Alex Trebek, and George W. Bush. Five-Timers Club host.

name: Cheri Oteri
bio: Cast member (1995-2000). Known for Spartan cheerleaders with Will Ferrell and Arianna the NBC page. Strong character work in late 1990s.

name: Darrell Hammond
bio: Cast member (1995-2009). Longest-tenured cast member until Kenan Thompson. Known for impressions of Bill Clinton, Sean Connery, and Donald Trump. Later became show announcer.

name: Ana Gasteyer
bio: Cast member (1996-2002). Known for NPR's Schweddy Balls sketch and Cady Heron's mom in Mean Girls references. Strong singer and character actress.

name: Tracy Morgan
bio: Cast member (1996-2003). Known for characters including Brian Fellow and Astronaut Jones. Left for successful television and film career (30 Rock).

name: Jimmy Fallon
bio: Cast member (1998-2004). Known for breaking character and laughing in sketches. Weekend Update anchor. Left to host Late Night, then The Tonight Show.

name: Tina Fey
bio: Cast member and head writer (2000-2006). First female head writer. Weekend Update anchor. Known for Sarah Palin impression. Left to create 30 Rock. Five-Timers Club host.

name: Amy Poehler
bio: Cast member (2001-2008). Weekend Update anchor and known for Hillary Clinton impressions. Co-founded Upright Citizens Brigade. Left to create Parks and Recreation. Multiple-time host.

name: Maya Rudolph
bio: Cast member (2000-2007). Known for impressions of Beyoncé, Oprah, and Kamala Harris. Daughter of singer Minnie Riperton. Has returned frequently as guest.

name: Rachel Dratch
bio: Cast member (2001-2006). Known for Debbie Downer character and Boston-themed sketches with Jimmy Fallon. Part of the successful early 2000s era.

name: Horatio Sanz
bio: Cast member (1998-2006). First Latino cast member. Known for breaking character and laughing. Played various supporting roles across eight seasons.

name: Chris Parnell
bio: Cast member (2001-2006). Known for straight-man roles and 'Lazy Sunday' digital short with Andy Samberg. Versatile character actor.

name: Seth Meyers
bio: Cast member and head writer (2001-2014). Weekend Update anchor for nine years (2006-2014). Left to host Late Night. Longest-tenured Update anchor until Colin Jost.

name: Kenan Thompson
bio: Cast member (2003-present). Longest-running cast member in SNL history (23 seasons). Former child star (Kenan & Kel, All That). Known for What's Up With That? and game show sketches.

name: Fred Armisen
bio: Cast member (2002-2013). Known for impressions of Barack Obama and characters in recurring sketches. Co-created Portlandia. Eleven seasons on the show.

name: Will Forte
bio: Cast member (2002-2010). Known for MacGruber character (later became a film). Also known for dramatic commitments to bizarre characters.

name: Andy Samberg
bio: Cast member (2005-2012). Known for Digital Shorts including 'Lazy Sunday' and 'I'm on a Boat'. Part of The Lonely Island. Left for Brooklyn Nine-Nine.

name: Kristen Wiig
bio: Cast member (2005-2012). Created numerous beloved characters including Target Lady, Penelope, and Gilly. One of the most versatile performers. Five-Timers Club host.

name: Bill Hader
bio: Cast member (2005-2013). Known for Stefon character on Weekend Update and impressions of Alan Alda. Eight seasons. Created and stars in Barry.

name: Jason Sudeikis
bio: Cast member (2005-2013). Known for Joe Biden impression and the 'What Up With That?' sketches. Left to focus on film career and later Ted Lasso.

name: Bobby Moynihan
bio: Cast member (2008-2017). Known for Drunk Uncle on Weekend Update and various quirky characters. Nine seasons on the show.

name: Nasim Pedrad
bio: Cast member (2009-2014). Known for Bedelia character and Kim Kardashian impressions. Five seasons before leaving for television work.

name: Jay Pharoah
bio: Cast member (2010-2016). Known for incredible impressions including Barack Obama, Jay-Z, and Denzel Washington. Six seasons on the show.

name: Taran Killam
bio: Cast member (2010-2016). Versatile performer known for impressions and sketch work. Six seasons before being let go in cast shakeup.

name: Vanessa Bayer
bio: Cast member (2010-2017). Known for characters including Miley Cyrus Show and Jacob the Bar Mitzvah Boy. Seven seasons on the show.

name: Kate McKinnon
bio: Cast member (2012-2022). Known for Hillary Clinton, Ruth Bader Ginsburg, and various aliens. Won two Emmys. Ten groundbreaking seasons. First openly lesbian cast member.

name: Aidy Bryant
bio: Cast member (2012-2022). Known for various characters and impressions. Ten seasons before leaving for Shrill and other projects.

name: Cecily Strong
bio: Cast member (2012-2022). Weekend Update anchor (2013-2014) and versatile sketch performer. Ten seasons. Known for variety of characters.

name: Colin Jost
bio: Cast member and head writer (2014-present). Weekend Update anchor since 2014. Now longest-running Update anchor in show history with Michael Che.

name: Michael Che
bio: Cast member (2014-present). Weekend Update anchor since 2014. Known for edgy jokes and chemistry with Colin Jost. Co-head writer.

name: Pete Davidson
bio: Cast member (2014-2022). Known for Weekend Update appearances discussing personal life. First cast member born in the 1990s. Eight seasons.

name: Leslie Jones
bio: Cast member (2014-2019). Known for energetic style and commentary pieces. Started as writer then promoted to cast. Five seasons on the show.

name: Beck Bennett
bio: Cast member (2013-2021). Known for straight-man roles and Putin impressions. Part of Good Neighbor sketch group. Eight seasons.

name: Kyle Mooney
bio: Cast member (2013-2022). Known for awkward, millennial-focused characters. Part of Good Neighbor. Nine seasons on the show.

name: Mikey Day
bio: Cast member (2016-present). Started as writer in 2013. Known for versatile character work and sketch writing. Nine seasons as performer.

name: Alex Moffat
bio: Cast member (2016-2022). Known for Eric Trump impression and various preppy characters. Six seasons on the show.

name: Melissa Villaseñor
bio: Cast member (2016-2022). First Latina promoted to repertory status. Known for impressions and singing. Six seasons.

name: Chris Redd
bio: Cast member (2017-2022). Known for Kanye West impression and musical performances. Five seasons before leaving in 2022.

name: Heidi Gardner
bio: Cast member (2017-2025). Known for Weekend Update characters including Bailey Gismert and Angel. Eight seasons before leaving after Season 50.

name: Ego Nwodim
bio: Cast member (2018-2025). Known for Lisa from Temecula character. Seven seasons before leaving after Season 50 announcement.

name: Chloe Fineman
bio: Cast member (2019-present). Master impressionist known for celebrity impersonations including Timothée Chalamet and Britney Spears. Six seasons.

name: Bowen Yang
bio: Cast member (2019-present). First East Asian cast member. First openly gay male cast member. Known for standout character work. Six seasons.

name: Andrew Dismukes
bio: Cast member (2021-present). Started as writer in 2017. Known for collaborations with James Austin Johnson. Four seasons as performer.

name: Sarah Sherman
bio: Cast member (2021-present). Known as Sarah Squirm. Known for body horror comedy and roasting Colin Jost. Four seasons.

name: James Austin Johnson
bio: Cast member (2021-present). Known for Donald Trump impression and other political figures. Four seasons as master impressionist.

name: Marcello Hernández
bio: Cast member (2022-present). Known for Domingo character and various Latino characters. Three seasons on the show.

name: Michael Longfellow
bio: Cast member (2022-2025). Known for Weekend Update appearances and relatable millennial humor. Three seasons before leaving.

name: Devon Walker
bio: Cast member (2022-2025). Known for impressions of Eric Adams and Michael Strahan. Three seasons before leaving.

name: Molly Kearney
bio: Cast member (2022-2024). First openly non-binary cast member. Two seasons before leaving the show.

name: Chloe Troast
bio: Cast member (2023-2024). Featured player for one season. Let go after Season 49.

name: Punkie Johnson
bio: Cast member (2020-2024). Known for Weekend Update pieces. Four seasons before leaving.

name: Ashley Padilla
bio: Cast member (2024-present). Featured player starting in Season 50. Known for viral videos and character work.

name: Jane Wickline
bio: Cast member (2024-present). Featured player starting in Season 50. Known for social media comedy and impressions.

name: Emil Wakim
bio: Cast member (2024-2025). Featured player for Season 50 only. Let go before Season 51.

name: Tommy Brennan
bio: Cast member (2025-present). Featured player starting in Season 51. Stand-up comedian from Saint Paul, Minnesota.

name: Jeremy Culhane
bio: Cast member (2025-present). Featured player starting in Season 51. UCB performer and Dropout TV regular.

name: Kam Patterson
bio: Cast member (2025-present). Featured player starting in Season 51. Stand-up comedian and Kill Tony podcast regular.

name: Veronika Slowikowska
bio: Cast member (2025-present). Featured player starting in Season 51. Social media comedian with 1 million Instagram followers.

name: Ben Marshall
bio: Cast member (2025-present). Featured player starting in Season 51. SNL writer since 2021 and member of Please Don't Destroy.
